description:
## Grid Cells and Subgrid Registration

Register horizontal grid cells and subgrid(s) together.

**This issue creates 2-3 entities:**
- Horizontal grid cells (1-2 entities)
- Horizontal subgrid(s) (1-2 entities) - auto-linked to cells

**Result:** Subgrid IDs (e.g., s100, s101) to use when creating Horizontal Computational Grid.

**Next Step:** Use subgrid IDs in Horizontal Computational Grid issue.
## Grid Purpose

label: Purpose Description
description: What are these grid cells for?\n\nExample: 'Mass variables on regular lat-lon grid for atmosphere at 1.25° × 0.9° resolution'
placeholder: e.g., Ocean grid cells for ORCA1 tripolar configuration

label: Number of Subgrids
description:
How many subgrids will use these cells?

- 1: Unstaggered (mass and velocity same location)
- 2: Staggered (e.g., Arakawa-C with separate mass/velocity)

Common: 2 for atmosphere/ocean
## Subgrid 1: Grid Cells and Variable Types

label: Subgrid 1 Variable Types
description:
Types of variables at this subgrid.

Common:
- **mass**: Mass-related, thermodynamic quantities
- **x-velocity**: Longitude velocity component
- **y-velocity**: Latitude velocity component
- **velocity**: Full vector (unstructured grids)

label: Subgrid 1 Grid Type
description:
Cell distribution pattern.

Common:
- **regular-latitude-longitude**: Uniform lat-lon
- **reduced-gaussian**: Gaussian
- **tripolar**: Ocean three-pole
- **cubed-sphere**: Cube on sphere
- **unstructured-polygon**: Irregular mesh

label: Subgrid 1 Coordinate System
description:
Coordinate reference.

Common:
- **latitude-longitude**: Standard spherical
- **rotated-latitude-longitude**: Rotated pole

label: Subgrid 1 Region
description: Geographic coverage.

label: Subgrid 1 Temporal Refinement
description:
How grid varies with time.

- **static**: Fixed
- **adaptive**: Mesh refinement
- **dynamically-stretched**: Moving mesh

label: Subgrid 1 X Resolution
description: Cell size in X (longitude) direction.\n\nOmit if varies >25%.

label: Subgrid 1 Y Resolution
description: Cell size in Y (latitude) direction.\n\nOmit if varies >25%.

label: Subgrid 1 Units
description: Units for resolution.\n\nRequired if resolution provided.

label: Subgrid 1 Number of Cells
description: Total cells.\n\nLeave blank if variable.

label: Subgrid 1 Southernmost Latitude
description: Southernmost latitude (degrees north).\n\n-90 to 90. Leave blank if not lat-lon.

label: Subgrid 1 Westernmost Longitude
description: Westernmost longitude (degrees east).\n\n0 to <360. Leave blank if not lat-lon.
## Subgrid 2: Grid Cells and Variable Types (if num_subgrids >= 2)\n\n**Skip all Subgrid 2 fields if only 1 subgrid**

label: Subgrid 2 Variable Types
description: Variable types for second subgrid.\n\nSkip if num_subgrids = 1.

label: Subgrid 2 Grid Type
description:
Cell distribution for second subgrid.

Skip if num_subgrids = 1.

Often same as Subgrid 1 for staggered grids.

label: Subgrid 2 Coordinate System
description: Coordinate system for second subgrid.\n\nSkip if num_subgrids = 1.

label: Subgrid 2 X Resolution
description: Skip if num_subgrids = 1.

label: Subgrid 2 Y Resolution
description: Skip if num_subgrids = 1.
## Spectral Grid Options (if applicable)\n\n**Only for spectral/Gaussian grids**

label: Truncation Method
description: Spherical harmonic truncation method.\n\nOnly for spectral grids.

label: Truncation Number
description: Zonal wave number for truncation.\n\nOnly for spectral grids.

## What Will Be Generated

This issue creates:

1. **horizontal_grid_cells** (IDs: g###, g###)
   - One for each subgrid
   - Contains: Grid type, resolution, cell count, region

2. **horizontal_subgrid** (IDs: s###, s###)
   - One for each subgrid
   - Auto-linked to corresponding grid_cells
   - Contains: Variable types, reference to grid_cells

**You'll receive:** Subgrid IDs (s###, s###)

**Next:** Use these subgrid IDs in Horizontal Computational Grid issue.
